doc.title: Moenjodaro: The City That Must Not Die
doc.plot: Concentrates on the partially excavated site of Moenjodaro and its architectural brick remains which date from 2300-1700 B.C. Closeups of the citadel, the ceremonial bath-house, drainage systems, wells, peristyle houses, etc., illustrate the complexity and progressive development of this urban settlement from its origins to its decline.
